definition: to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])
Hezekiah or Ezekias (740-687 BC), twelfth king of Judah (Judaism)
Ahab (9th c. BC), King of Israel, son of Omri and husband of Jezebel, prominent figure in 1 Kings 16-22
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
Gideon (name, from Judges 6:11-ffoll.)/also written 吉迪恩
Philistine (Palestinian people, reputedly uncircumcised, c. 1,000 BC)
Jehu (842-815 BC), Israelite king, prominent character in 2 Kings 9:10
Jezebel, wife of Ahab and mother of Ahaziah, major character in 1 Kings 16:31, 19:1, 21 and 2 Kings 9, killed by Jehu 耶戶|耶户[Ye1 hu4]
Jephthah (Hebrew: Yiftach) son of Gilead, Judges 11-foll.
